Package ecom

Class ECommerceApp

java.lang.Object
ecom.ECommerceApp
public class ECommerceApp extends Object
Primary user interface class simulates an e-commerce shopping experience User is allowed to browse product catalog, and add items to cart with arbitrary quantity they can then view the cart, add or delete cart line items, and "checkout." When they are done, the user can choose to exit the program.

  • Method Details

    • getAction

      private static int getAction()
      Presents the user with a menu of options loops until a valid integer is returned. NOTE: integer is NOT checked against menu choices for validity. THe validity check is provided by the caller.
      Returns:
      the user input integer

    • addItem

      public static void addItem()
      User interface for adding an item to a cart. Prompts the user to enter an item no. loops until a valid integer is entered. Prompts for a desired quantity. Loops until a valid integer is entered. NOTE: function does NOT provide error checking on the two input integers, this is expected to be completed by userCart.addLine(). Calls userCart.addLine() to actually add the item.

    • delItem

      public static void delItem()
      User interface for deleting an item from the cart. Prompts the user to enter a cart line no and then loops until a valid int is entered. Calls userCart.delLine() to actually delete the line. NOTE: this method does NOT actually check if the provided int is a valid lineNo. This validation is provided by ShoppingCart.delLine()

    • checkOut

      public static void checkOut()
      Simulates the user interface for checking out a cart. Returns a confirmation message to the user. Abandons the old cart and generates a fresh cart which can be used for new purchases.

    • getDetails

      public static void getDetails()
      Provides user interface through which the user can request full details for a specific product Prompts user for an Item No and then loops until a valid int is provided. Looks up the itemNo in the Product class and if it is found then calls printDetails() to show details for that item;

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
